column1: Warner is off and running with a first-ball four. Overpitched and slanting away outside off with the angle, Warner plunges forward and creams a drive in the gap at the covers
Woakes drags his length back outside off, Warner protects his off stump and shoulders arms. Better length from Woakes
back of a length and around off stump, Warner cries 'wait on' after stabbing an inside edge to mid-on
back of a length again, angling across off, Warner cries 'wait on' once again, after dabbing it gently towards point
much fuller, starts on off and nips away further, Warner judges it well and lets it go
fuller and attacking middle stump, Warner inches forward and pokes it towards point to close out the first over

Ooooooh, Finch has been given out lbw by umpire Dharmasena. Finch reckons he has snicked it? Finch has a word with Warner and challenges the on-field out decision. Archer begins with a full inswinger, Finch is very vulnerable to it, particularly early in his innings. Starts outside off and nips back in towards middle, Finch gets too far across, plays around his front pad, much like how Kohli did yesterday v Boult, and is struck on the flap of the front pad. This is cannoning into middle stump. The tracker returns three reads and off you go for a golden duck in the semi-final, Finch
he welcomes Smith with a sizzling bouncer, he ducks under it and lets it go
just short of a good length and outside off, Smith stabs an inside edge to the leg side now
Smith jumps across off in his own inimitable way, tips it in front of short midwicket, and sets off for a single
short at the hips, Archer has Warner hopping and skipping now, glanced to long leg
on a length and on a fourth-stump line, Smith whisks it away to mid-on
Woakes hits a hard length on middle, Warner hops again, jabbing back to the bowler
short on middle and leg, cramps Warner for room, fended back to the bowler
Look at that shot! Thunderous wallop straight over the bowler's head. Pitched further up on middle, Warner extends his arms and launches it down the ground

Nasty, prancing delivery and Warner has been bounced out. Woakes wheels away in celebration. England could not have asked for a better start to the semi-final. Back of a length and slanting away outside off from over the wicket, explodes from the deck, seams away further. Warner is squared up. He fends at it and tickles it to second slip where YJB grabs a sharp chance in front of his face

Woakes bowls the full inswinger now, Handscomb now falls over. Umpire Erasmus shakes his head. England review. Handscomb plays down the wrong line and is rapped on the front pad well above the knee-roll. Reckon height may be a concern here. Impact in line, but the tracker returns umpire's call on leg stump. So, England don't lose their review
pitched up and outside off, Handscomb leans out and drives sweetly to extra-cover, the ball bursts out of the fielder's hands. It was captain Morgan, I think
short and hurled in on middle at 142ks, Handscomb is happy hang back in his crease and pick it off through square leg
sharp lifter, 140ks, Archer catches Smith in a tangle, spliced in front of cover
short and swerves away outside off, finishes wider than a set of stumps outside off, but Smith still spars at it and is beaten emphatically. The ball was doing too much to graze the edge
banged in short, splice-jarring length, inside-edged onto the pad
shorter and outside off, 140ks, Smith goes back and across, calmly fending it back to the bowler
Archer lets rip a proper bouncer, flies through to the keeper, as Smith rocks his head out of the way
another full inswinger from Woakes, nips in from wide of the crease, raps Handscomb on the front pad again. Okay, an inside edge saves Handscomb, Morgan rightly decided against a review
on a length and jags back in again, takes the inside edge and rolls away to the leg side
pitched up, starts outside off and curves away late, the sort of ball that tempted Rahul yesterday. Smith tucks his bat inside the line and lets it go
good length, angling in towards off, straightening just enough to take the outside edge. Sliced out to point
pitched further up, wobbling away against the angle, Smith judges it well. Nothing doing from him
after taking a few balls away from Smith, Woakes brings this full ball back into Smith and opens him up. Prodded to cover
back of a length and homing in at off stump, Handscomb is happy to camp back and pat it towards point
back of a length, angling in towards off, tricks Handscomb into playing for the angle but it straightens away at 145ks to beat the outside edge
shorter and zipping away past the outside edge once again. Archer cranks up to 146ks. The pressure from both ends is relentless
back of a length and holds its line around off, Archer keeps hitting the deck hard, spliced out in front of point
shorter and wider outside off, no shot
shorter and outside off, Handscomb rides it down to square-ish third man

The nip-backer from Woakes, bursting through the defences of Handscomb. Nice and full, bends back in towards middle, Handscomb has a loose drive at it, sitting back and leaving enough bat-pad gap for the ball to zip through and rattle the furniture. Australia three down for 14 inside seven overs
good length, starts on off, and nibbles away, catches Carey in the crease and his outside edge but does not carry to Root at second slip
shorter and slanting in at off, Smith shuffles across off stump and taps it to short midwicket
fullish and angling in at off stump, Smith stretches out and plays it up to cover
shorter and angling in at the body as Smith shuffles across and awkwardly fends it away
back of a length, swings away after passing the batsman, left alone
shorter and zipping through the channel, ignored by Carey
pitched further up on middle, presses forward and bunts it straight of mid-on. Nice, confident stroke from Carey
back of a length on middle, Smith gets inside the line and whips it away towards short midwicket
back of a length and on a fourth-stump line, defended to the right of cover. Morgan swoops down on the ball, but can't throw the stumps down at the bowler's end. Smith dishes out a sprawling dive
back of a length on off, punchily driven to the man at mid-off

Another nasty, prancing delivery from Archer. So nasty that it detaches Carey's helmet. 86mph, Carey looks away, ducks into it, cops it on the chin area, and the helmet flies off. Carey is bleeding and gets some treatment on his chin in the middle. The ball just about bounced over the stumps. Tense faces in the Australia change room. Remember, Harmison v Ponting?
fuller and wobbles away outside off, Smith simply watches it through to the keeper
short and angling into middle, Smith jumps across and deflects it away square on the leg side
back of a length and angling across off, no shot from Carey whose chin is plastered up now
short on the hips, cramps 'em up for room, fended off the back foot to the leg side
that's a gem from Woakes. Perfect length, angling away, swerving away outside off, Carey reaches out. Feels for the ball and is beaten neck and crop
crunnnnnnnnnnnched between extra-cover and mid-off. It was overpitched alright, but Carey leans into it and drives it away like a boss. Fetch that
just short of a good length and outside off, 146kph, Smith diffuses it to cover
fuller and straightening away outside off, sliced out to deep third man
short at the hips, glanced away to Rashid at long leg
shorter, chest-hunting ball, fended away behind square off the back foot
lifter on leg stump, 90mph, Carey ducks under it and takes shelter
short and zipping across off from over the wicket, Carey drops his gloves and lets it go
on a length and angling in outside off, played back off the front foot
good length and angling into a neat front-foot push on off stump
much fuller and outside off, the bat turns in Smith's hands as he stabs off the inside half to midwicket
shorter and wider outside off, Smith latches onto the width and lashes the ball away to sweeper cover off the back foot
short of a length, might have pitched outside leg, Carey falls over and wears it on the thigh pad
back of a length and angling across off, Carey shoulders arms
hits a hard length right away, angling in on off, Smith is rushed into a defence to the leg side
short and holds its line outside off, Smith gets on top of the ball and punches it to short cover
overpitched and outside off, Smith opens the face and drills it to sweeper on the off side
sharp bouncer outside off, Carey has nothing to do with it, sails through to the keeper
back of a length and skidding away outside off, left alone
short on off, Carey hops and fends back
mighty full, starts outside off and nips away, finishing past the tramline. Off-side wide
very full and wide outside off, Smith doesn't need any second invitations. Caressed away to sweeper cover
full and swinging away outside off, Carey loses his patience. He slashes recklessly and misses
banged down the leg side, 140ks, Carey swerves out of the way, leg-side wide now from Wood
another leg-side delivery, Carey gets a little tickle, Woakes runs across from long leg, slides near the edge of the boundary, and hauls the ball in smartly. He saves a couple for England
Stokes throws himself to his right from backward point and stops a certain four. Short and outside off, thrashed on the up. Stokes swoops down on the ball. England's fielding has been sharp today
very full and slanting down the leg side as Smith shuffles across and does not get any bat onto his leg-side flick
good length and holds its line outside off, Smith ignores it
wide of the crease, angling in towards off, forces Smith into jabbing at it, then straightens late past the outside edge. Cracking ball to close out a long over. Nearly found the edge
short on leg stump, dinked into the midwicket region for one
banged in short and outside off, Smith swivels on the back foot and hauls a pull to the right of midwicket. That should give Australia some breathing space. First boundary for Smith
fuller and holds its line outside off, ignored
sharp, lifting delivery outside off, diffused back to Stokes
Smith jumps across off, gets inside the line and pootles a flick to the right of mid-on
Smith leaps back, rides the bounce of this short ball outside off and glides it away to the left of backward point and right of deep third man
banged in short and angling away, Carey leaps and fends it off to po
bumper, slanting away outside off, Carey swivels... but shelves the hook at the last instant
Wood keeps pushing Carey back with the short stuff, Carey ducks under another one
short on middle, run away to point, and Carey - his jaw strapped and all - gets off strike
much fuller on off, Smith hangs back and carves an outside edge, but wide of backward point. Trickles down to deep third man
Carey rides the bounce of this short ball and plays it to point
pitched up and drilled back down the ground, timing and placement and that's the shot of the day for Australia so far
cutter on the stumps, Smith nurdles this through midwicket
on the stumps, 128kph/78mph and Carey pokes back down the track
fullish, around middle and off, defended coming forwards
sweetly struck by Carey this time, almost beats mid-off but Roy gets a hand to the ball and Wood hares after it all the way to the rope to prevent four more
shortish outside off, dabbed down square
back of a length from round the wicket, blocked down into the on side
dropped down into the off side, this could be a tight run but Smith called it running to the danger end and makes it safely
short outside off, stroked towards backward point
banged in short, 141kph/88mph and Smith nods his head out of the way coming across
dug in, 86mph and taken off the ribs through backward square leg, the sweeper has to run around and they get back for two
slashed for four! Smith finding his range now, opens the face and whiplashes a drive behind point - no cutting that off
length on the stumps, 132kph/82mph and Carey works across the line
in the channel outside off, Smith runs this down to third man
tight lines from Plunkett, defended into the covers
this is too straight, taken off the pads through backward square leg
short of a length outside off, Carey blocks towards extra cover, early call of 'No!'
length ball, 130kph/81mph pushed towards mid-off
banged in short, rising up around the eyes but Smith is well in control as he pulls smoothly through backward square leg for four
on the stumps, 146kph/91mph and flicked off the pads as Smith shuffles across
round the wicket, 90mph and pitched back of a length, Carey defends on off stump
fuller and a touch wide, 148kph/92mph this time, mistimed on the drive and loops to mid-off
back of a length and tucked towards midwicket
touch short, 91mph outside off and Carey settles for running one to third man
flighted on middle and off, Carey chips it back to the bowler... bump ball
pushed through outside off, maybe the wrong'un, Carey cuts but can't get it past backward point
touch short, Carey goes deep and flat-bats this hard past the dive of Rashid to long-on
tossed up, spinning a touch as Smith goes back and taps into the covers
gets him coming forwards, driven in the air... but between cover and mid-off, that'll scuttle away to the rope! Risk in the shot but Carey gets his reward
tossed up on middle and leg, tapped back to the bowler
fullish outside off, Smith drives firmly but Plunkett gather in his follow through
pitched up on off stump and again Smith pings it back to the bowler, admonishes himself... and presumably makes a mental note to practise that shot in the shower later
shorter length, comes across and opens the face for one
length ball on leg stump, tucked to midwicket
angled across from over the wicket, Carey strokes into the covers
shortish, 129kph/80mph and whipped off the pads, just one to deep backward square
tossed up, Carey spring-heels down the pitch but can't get under the ball, dinked down the ground to long-on
floated up full on off and driven back past the bowler
full on leg stump, Carey gets the ball away fine on the sweep for two more
tossed up wide of off stump, slightly quicker and steered through backward point
pushed through, Smith goes back and stuns a drive past mid-on
flighted, Carey is well forward and dabs into the covers, they set off early and although Buttler sprints out and has a shy at the non-striker's, he was safely in
length ball tapped into the covers on the front foot
timing from Carey, like he's a Swiss watch-maker... Stroked through the covers, no one out there for protection
shortish, misses out on a flick off the hip
touch full of a length and driven coming forwards on off, one back past the bowler
was that a chance? No, didn't quite carry to backward point... Excellent diving stop from Stokes, in the event, as Smith opened the face to flash an uppish drive
length, sliding into the pads, deflected wide of Buttler... Plunkett seems to enquire about lbw, but settles for the dot ball
floated up and whipped with the spin through midwicket
flighted, Smith punches along the carpet to mid-off
waits for this to pitch and then straighten, tapped square of cover... and then Rashid can only get fingertips on the throw to deflect it past the man backing up and gift them an overthrow
floated up on off, pushed towards extra cover
flighted, slightly wide and Smith is forward, skelps a drive in front of the cover sweeper for two
punched into a gap coming across
length ball on the stumps, clipped through midwicket
round the wicket, slung down the leg side as Carey throws the hands - a wide brings up the Australia 100
pitched up and driven through the covers coming forwards
touch short and Smith bottom-handed shovels through square leg
full outside off, 131kph/81mph and it clips the inside edge as Carey pushes forward
leg-side cutter from Plunkett, doesn't get up
hits a length and Carey sends it to mid-off
touch fuller on off, blocked into the covers with half a stride
this one spins, but the line was very wide and Smith takes the extra
pushed through and punched back down the ground for one
tosses up the googly, Carey spots it and absolutely belts a flat slog-sweep in front of deep midwicket! Superb connection on that, no chance for the boundary rider
sliding across and dabbed off the back foot behind point
floats up another Bosie, Smith punches down the ground
tossed up on off stump, Carey drops back and runs it towards short third man
flat legbreak outside off, Smith cracks it through the covers for one more
short ball outside off, Smith dabs down to third man
pitched up from over the wicket, 138kph/86mph and clipped to mid-on
short ball, pulled off the hip and they get a couple towards deep midwicket
tempter in the channel, 139kph/87mph and Carey has a little flirt without moving his feet
pitched up leg side and skidding into the pads
good length on off, defended down into the covers
driven coming forwards, well struck but Stokes does well to cut it off on the dive at extra cover

skips down, flicked leg side... but too well! Picks out deep midwicket on the fence! That's the partnership broken, and it came from a lapse rather than any great delivery, just a wander down the pitch and chipping to the fielder! A shot without due Carey attention and England have their fourth
pushed through on off, Smith runs it to backward point
lobbed up on the stumps, Smith drive back past the bowler - that's his half-century up, a top knock in the circumstances. Can he convert, as he in the semi did four years ago?
floated up and punched to cover

googly, hit on the knee roll... GIVEN! Australia have no reviews! Was it high? The ball actually hit the thigh pad, skidding on inside a woolly waft from Stoinis, and after an age Dharmasena's finger went up! Smith gives a look of anguish at the non-striker's end as Stoinis heads off. Might well have been umpire's call - but what a call that was!
Smith comes across and works this behind square on the leg side
edged behind backward point, slightly wafty from Smith but he gets one for it
full outside off, Maxwell appears to be late on it as the ball squeezes under the bat through to the keeper
shortish and clipped off the pads through square leg
spanked through cover! Slightly overpitched but that's a peerless shot from Smith! Threading the gap as he goes back and across
on the body and nudged behind square
tossed up, this spins sharply away as Smith goes back and slaps down the ground
flighted legbreak, turn again, Maxwell drives and edges wide of slip! Root was diving to his right, just got enough bat on it to squirt a couple away
pushed through on the stumps, Maxwell defends
grip for Rashid, finds the outside edge again - though this one dies quickly, runs to short third man
floated up on the stumps and pushed into the covers
pushed through and Maxwell dabs towards mid-off - another good over from Rashid, who seems to have discovered his groove
short of a length, maybe a slower ball and Smith works it through midwicket
back of a length on off, Maxwell shows it a straight bat
comes across and lines this one up
banged in, Maxwell swivels and pulls, arms extended and battered through midwicket for four! Passes his first test
beaten this time, on a length, indeterminate footwork from Maxwell, nibbling through to the keeper
Archer digs this in short, more grunt in the bumper and Maxi ducks
floated up and tapped into the off side
pushes through a googly, Smith goes back and runs it to short third man
floats up the legbreak, straightening on leg stump and Smith tucks it away
smoked over long-on! Big hit from the Big Show! Tossed up and in the zone, Maxwell stays still and then cleans the ball out with a crisp swing
flatter, on the stumps, defended
tossed up on off stump, patted into the covers
dug in short on middle, Smith ducks out of the way and lets it go
shortish and angling into off, Smith jumps across and flicks but backward square lurks and stops it
on a length and moves away outside off, slower variation from Archer. Smith stabs early and is beaten
back of a length and on a fourth-stump line, played back to the bowler
Smith rises on top of a short ball outside off and forces to sweeper cover
leg-stump half-volley, Maxwell only picks it away to deep midwicket
Maxwell continues to attack Rashid. He heaves this against the break to cow corner. YJB cuts it off in the outfield
pushed through on middle, played back to the bowler
was that the wrong'un? Looks like but dragged short, punched to midwicket off the back foot
heaved away once again, this time between deep midwicket and long-on. Dragged down outside off, and duly put away off the back foot by Maxwell
short and spins away outside off, laced to sweeper off the back foot
tossed on middle, eased down to long-off off the front foot
full and wide outside off, Smith chases a drive and inside-edges it to fine leg
shorter and outside off, Maxwell solidly steers to sweeper cover
shortish and angling into a leg-side flick to backward square leg
bumper on middle, Smith ducks under it. Too high, so that's a wide
wedged into the gap between midwicket and backward square leg
another bumper, another wide, Archer has a wry smile on his face

Spliced into the lap of short cover. Slower variation from Archer, he rolls his fingers across it, kicks up from a length and tricks Maxwell into lobbing it to Morgan. Archer was brought back for this and he delivers. Okay, replays suggest it was the knuckle ball from Archer
mighty full and outside off, stabbed to point with an open face
googly, worked off the back foot to deep midwicket
Cummins stretches out and drives with the break to sweeper cover
Smith presses forward and whisks this full ball to short midwicket
dirty long-hop on middle, pulled only as far as deep midwicket
short and darted outside off, forced down to long-off off the back foot
tossed outside off, stretches out and drills to extra-cover
short and angling into off, run down to the right of deep third man
full and on off, punched to mid-on
another slower variation, stops on off, another knuckle ball, nearly carries back for a return catch
lifter outside off, Cummins tries to ramp it away... No dice
banged in short, nearly spliced back to the bowler
full and heading down leg, deflected to fine leg
dangled up on off stump, Smith plays it back to the bowler
slid through faster on off, Smith stays leg-side of the ball and smears it to cover
tossed up and turns away outside off, Smith flashes the ball away to sweeper cover

Grabbed at first slip. Joe Root goes low hangs onto the fast-travelling ball to leave Australia seven down and sinking. Flighted and drifts in just outside off and turns away. Cummins has a crack at it and snicks it behind. Wicket no. 3 for Rashid, in his last over
sliding across off, wrong'un, drags Starc forward and beats the outside edge
starts on leg stump and turns away viciously past the outside edge and the off stump. A ripping wrong'un to close out the spell. Well done, Rashid
shorter and outside off, fended off to the covers for one
short and just a shade outside off, stabbed past slip to third man
lifter outside off, Smith manages to pat it down to point
back of a length and outside off, punched away to the left of cover
full on the stumps, Starc hangs back and picks it away to the right of deep midwicket
bouncer outside off, flies to the keeper, Starc drops his wrists. Archer finishes with 2 for 32 in his 10
back of a length and skidding through outside off, Smith leans back for a drive but the ball whistles past the outside edge
banged in outside off, Smith goes airborne and lashes it away to the right of sweeper cover
Smith shuffles across off, gets inside the line of this length ball and tickles a single to fine leg
back of a length and holds its line outside off from round the stumps, punched straight to short cover
shorter and outside off, fenced down to deep third man
dug in short and just a shade outside off, fended back to Wood
full on middle, Starc shovels a drive down to mid-on
short at the body from round the wicket, blocked to mid-on
back of a length and outside off, Starc yanks his bottom hand off the handle and splices it to mid-off
length ball on off stump, tight lines, defended back to the bowler
just short of a good length and outside off, Starc throws his bat at the ball... and misses
Starc clears his front leg and smites this length ball from off to long-on
short and sliding into the body from round the wicket, fended off for one
bouncer angling in on middle, Smith ducks under it
good length and angling in on middle, Smith shuffles across and deflects the ball in front of square on the leg side
short and outside off, helped down to third man
Smith hangs back to a full ball on off and whips it away to fine leg like only e can
lifter on off, drop and run to point
fended to fine leg for one
short and outside off, Smith goes hard on a pull and drags it to midwicket. Smith runs around Plunkett and dishes out a desperate dive. A direct hit could have had Smith
slower short ball outside off, Starc delays his pull and strokes it to deep midwicket
back of a length on off stump, Smith shuffles in line and punches back to the bowler
slower variation once again. Short, wide, slapped straight to backward point
shorter and outside off, carved away to the right of deep third man. Smith comes back for the second
yorker, homing in at the toes, squeezed to the leg side
shot, Starc! He leans back to a half-volley on off, and muscles a drive straight of mid-off
fuller and straighter, clipped to midwicket
lifter on middle, Starc gets under it
short and shoved down the leg side for a wide
back of a length on off, stabbed in front of point for one
back of a length and angling into a punch to short midwicket's left
pitched up and outside off, right in the wheelhouse for Starc. It's a slower ball, but Starc hoists it over mid-off
short and attacking the body, clipped off the back foot behind the leg umpire
glanced from middle stump to fine leg as Smith jumps across and gets inside the line. 200 up for Australia in the 45th over
bumper on middle, Starc ducks under it, the leg umpire deems it a wide
short and wide outside off, scythed away off the back foot but straight to point
slower ball on off stump, a whirl of the wrists sends the ball into the gap behind square on the leg side
First boundary for Smith since the 29th over. Hip-high short ball outside off, Smith camps back, sizes it up and puts it away to the midwicket boundary. Cracking pull
shorter and angling across, Starc stays leg-side of the ball and guides it down to square-ish third man
back of a length and outside off, drag-flicked away to deep midwicket
back of a length and on off stump, played back down the pitch to mid-off
slower short ball outside off, swatted away, tennis-style, down to mid-off
hip-high short ball on middle, Starc swivels on the back foot and swings it away to deep square

back of a length, angling in from wide of the crease, Smith falls over the flick, and Woakes spins around for an lbw appeal. Not given by the umpire, so Morgan challenges the on-field not-out decision. Smith was struck on the flap of the front pad. No inside edge, height may be an issue. Trimming the bails, and the tracker returns umpire's call
slower ball from Wood, an inside edge saves Smith. He turns the strike over
back of a length on middle, hangs back and works a double through midwicket
picked away off the pads to fine leg
full on middle, hangs back and bunts the ball to mid-on
short ball, aimed at the throat, Starc top-edges a hook, but it lands in front of fine leg. Fifty stand off 57 balls from Smith and Starc
dug in short and outside off, tugged away to deep midwicket off the back foot

slower ball on middle, 116ks, Smith is early into the pull and is fooled by the lack of pace. Deflected off the body behind the stumps. Smith and Starc chance a leg bye. Buttler takes his right glove off, swoops down on the ball, and nails a direct hit at the non-striker's end to catch Smith short. England needed some brilliance to end Smith's innings

Two in two for England. Both set batsmen gone. Why didn't Morgan go to him earlier? Seam-up, hits a hard length outside off. Starc has an almighty swish at it... and simply feathers it behind to Buttler
back of a length and outside off, resolutely defended
back of a length and just a shade outside off, Lyon angles out to point and sets off. Archer can't throw the stumps down and capitalise on a little mix-up
much fuller on off, stabbed away towards mid-on
shorter and hits the bat hard, spliced out to cover. Just one run and two wickets off that Woakes over
back of a length and zipping away outside off, Lyon has a waft at it. Nearly scratches the edge
banged in short and angling in at the body, defeats the hook. The ball rolls to the off side and Lyon brings Behrendoff back on strike
dug in on middle, stays leg-side of the ball and tickles a single down to deep third man
shovel-pulled away to fine leg
full-toss on off stump, smeared away to sweeper cover
sizzing yorker from Wood. 146ks, bursts under Behrendoff's bat and pings the off stump. Wood pumps his fist and wraps up Australia for 223
shortish length, outside off at 131kph/81mph and Roy feels for it slightly, gets an inside edge to backward square leg
length on middle stump, defended back down the track with a straight bat
length ball, a touch leg side and tucked toward midwicket
back of a length, 137kph/85mph and sliding across as Roy opens his shoulders and slices towards third man for the first England run
overpitched and wide, Bairstow steps out and creams his first ball through point for four! A more guttural response from the crowd this time
pitched up, swinging in a fraction as YJB defends... there's half an appeal, maybe pad involved but I think bat first. No review
pitched up, on the money straight away but Roy is forwards and drives smoothly to mid-on
length ball, 146kph/91mph and slanting across on off, defended square
good pace, up above 90mph on middle and off stump, blocked firmly
slams this into the pitch again, 148kph/92mph as Roy squares himself up to defend watchfully
smashed in short, Roy is late on this, takes a blow on body... 151kph/94mph from Starc, no doubt he's feeling it. And Roy will be too
length but starting too straight and swinging down the leg side
on target again, 144 clicks but Roy just calmly taps it back down the pitch
on the stumps, shaping in a touch and defended back down the track
good length, 133kph/82mph outside off, pushed towards extra cover
pitched up, attacking the stumps and YJB drives along the carpet towards mid-on
presses on to the front foot and blocks towards cover
line of beauty from Behrendorff, nearly does for Bairstow! Good length and then nipping across as the batsman feels for it
done him again, full and he goes for the booming drive, scuttles through low past the outside edge! Maiden from Behrendorff
no trouble this time, pitched up and flayed through the covers for four! Roy finds the boundary for the first time
more runs, this time whipped through midwicket as Starc overpitches a fraction
pushed across the bows as Roy gets into line
back of a length, 150kph/93mph and defended with a straight bat
dug in outside off, 90mph and Roy rides it, steered down into the gully region
pinged! That's gone to the rope on rails! Not a bad ball from Starc but Roy was moving well, trusted the bounce and c-r-u-u-u-u-u-u-u-u-u-n-c-h-e-d through cover
full on off, 134kph/82mph and Bairstow drives, mid-on comes across
touch wide, YJB drops back and throws the hands through a bottom-edged cut
shortish and worked off the hip through square leg
back of a length over leg stump and Roy bottom-hands a force in front of deep square for a couple
back of a length, pushed back down the track
makes a move down the pitch but Behrendorff cramps him, jabbed into the leg side
short, 145kph/90mph but slung down the leg side again
thunk! Absolutely zootered off the middle of the bat! Short but wide from Starc and Bairstow is up on his tippy-toes to ram a cut past the dive of Maxwell at point
tighter to the stumps, shows it a respectful straight bat this time
shortish on off stump, 142kph/88mph and Bairstow sets up immediately after stabbing into the leg side... but an early 'No! No! No!' from Roy averts disaster
angled across on a length, Bairstow sits back and glides to third man

pitched up and flicked off the pads, is fine leg in the game... No, it goes all the way for six! Familiar wristy pugilism from Roy, who purses his lips and wanders up the track after watching the ball clear the rope and thump into the boundary boards
back of a length on the stumps, nothing to hit this time and Roy defends
barrels in and pitches the ball short, angling towards the body and YJB tucks it away calmly
tight lines, short of a length and tapped down
fuller, Bairstow comes forward to drive but checks it and gets a thickish inside edge
spicy bumper, 'perfume ball' around off stump and YJB sways out of the way
short of a length outside off, 141kph/88mph and Bairstow punches on the up towards point
full and inviting the drive, stroked through the covers for a couple more
ooh, nearly gets himself in trouble... Roy advancing and then decides late to try and guide the ball instead, just clears the top edge
touch short on off stump, pushed into the covers
smacks into the pads, Roy standing in front of his stumps... but it must have pitched outside leg. Kumar Dharmasena signals a leg bye
length on the stumps, 130kph/81mph and Bairstow whips it behind square for a couple
pitched up and drilled... Behrendorff sticks out a paw but can't prevent four, neither can the chasing mid-off! It was in the air, but not even remotely a chance
hangs back on off stump and steers towards point
bit of nibble from back of a length, seaming in to hit Roy on the thigh
excellent line, 142kph/88mph over the top of off and Roy is beaten trying to work it to leg
banged this one in short, Roy ducks
length ball, 138kph/86mph and pushed down into the off side
touch fuller, pushed in with the arm and Roy nudges it towards midwicket
whippage! Wristed away through square leg, taken from off stump and sent racing to the rope at deep backward square to spoil an otherwise immaculate over from Cummins
length ball on the stumps, deflected into the leg side
Roy works one more off his pads
good length and tucked to the on side again
slightly overpitched and Roy snaps on it like a beartrap again, two more out towards wide long-off
slower ball from Behrendorff, punched back down the ground - raises the 50 opening stand between J-Roy and YJB
shortish on leg stump, turned to square leg
launched down the ground first ball! Roy plants this for a straight six, never mind the fact long-on was back! Welcome to the game, Garry
done him in the flight, some form of revenge for Lyon, as Roy pushes at it hesitantly and misses
pushed through and slapped off the back foot through cover point
flat offbreak, YJB gets across and down early to shovel behind square
slapped disdainfully through backward point, reverse-swat from Roy and it races away! No chance for the spinner to settle
fired in quicker and Roy gets turned around, but a leading edge falls safely
shortish, 142kph/88mph on off, prodded back towards the bowler
short ball, wheeled away down to fine leg on the pull
trapped on the crease, concerted appeal for lbw from Cummins... Heading leg side? Australia choose not to gamble on a review
slammed in short, heading leg side - Carey leaps in vain and it whistles away to the rope!
slashed through backward point, they come haring back for a second... but Bairstow immediately crumples to his knees and seems to be in some trouble
good nut from Cummins, sidling back in at 141kph/88mph to strike YJB on the thigh pad
god length in the channel and punched on the up wide of mid-off, quickly fielded
pushes through an offbreak, cut off the back foot in front of off stump
YJB gets down early to attempt a paddle but only manages to deflect it into his front pad
pulled hard off the back foot but square leg does well to cut it off and prevent one
swings like a barn door in the breeze, but a thick top edge evades short third man and runs away! Cummins can't pull it back on the rope!
tossed up and tucked into the leg side
flatter outside off, goes back to cut but finds a fielder
short length outside off, 142kph/88mph and Roy punches, gets a thick inside edge into his pads
slower ball, pops up to hit the splice as Roy turns it to the on side
back of a length, 89mph on the hip and helped on its way, using the pace to beat fine leg
banged in, steepling bumper that Roy leaves well alone
on the stumps, jabbed into the leg side
length, 140kph/87mph cross-seamer and pushed uppishly towards mid-off... not in control, but lands just short
pitched up and larruped over mid-off! Short shift from YJB, not much in the way of footwork, simply boshed down the ground
better length, sliced behind point for one
full, no swing and this is basically a half-volley, pumped back down the ground! Roy gives Starc some tap now
short and wide, crashed towards point, well fielded
spared down the leg side at 145kph/90mph... Carey comes up appealing for a catch, but the umpire signals wide
smashed through cover! Roy raises his fifty, as he goes about razing Australia in this semi-final... From the sounds of it, the England fans in the house are beginning to believe
shortish and worked to leg for one more
floated up and Roy reaches for a cross-batted swipe down the ground
floated full but drifting down the leg side as Bairstow aims a vengeful blow
tossed up, YJB crunches this flat and hard but Maxwell swoops brilliantly at long-on to keep them to one
full toss, smeared over the head of long-on! No chance for the leaping Maxwell this time, clattered down the ground for six
goes again, hard and flat for a straight six! Humpty-Dumpty and it sails over the rope
OUT OF THE GROUND! Or into the top tier at least... Roy goes into Beast Mode with a murderous blow down the ground. Brutal from Roy, who's having fun now
flatter outside off, tapped square
on the stumps and worked to leg
whipped away through the leg side, well fielded on the midwicket boundary
length, stopping in the pitch a touch, pushed back down the track
pitched up, 78mph and squirted towards backward point
pitched up and steered towards extra cover on the front foot
pushes this one down the leg side
hauled through midwicket! Makes the move and then muscles it away in front of deep midwicket, the crowd lapping it up now!
Starc bangs a short ball on leg stump, YJB ducks under it

Starc provides Australia with the breakthrough. It looks plumb, but Bairstow calls for a review. Full inswinger from over the wicket, Bairstow plays around it and is pinned on the back leg in line with middle. This is cannoning into middle and there's a tiny opening for Australia
bumper on the leg stump, 143ks, Root rises with it and flaps it away with the glove. The ball balloons to the left of the diving keeper
back of a length and angling across off, solidly punched into the covers
full and heading down the leg side, tickled away on its way to the fine leg boundary
short and wide outside off, Root latches onto the width and cracks it away to the sweeper boundary off the back foot
shortish and outside off, sits up to be hit. Roy happily obliges. Slugs it to midwicket, the ball bursts through the hands and into the boundary
back of a length and holds its line outside off, eased down to deep third man
on a length and outside off, guided to point off the front foot
short and outside off, punched to extra-cover
much fuller and just a shade outside off, driven to mid-off off the front foot
short and outside off, jabbed away to square point. There's a backward point lurking as well
on the pads, tucked away to fine leg
short and wide outside off, flayed away in the gap between square point and backward point. Beats deep third man as well
Root rides the bounce of this short ball outside off and pulls it away to deep midwicket

Has Roy been bounced out? Umpire Dharmasena raises his finger. Lifter at the arm-pit of Roy, heading down the leg side, Roy aims a pull, but it's miles away from his reach. Good grab from Carey - injured jaw and all - but the question is was there bat on this? Replays suggest Roy did not touch it. England have lost their review and Roy has to go. He's seething, but umpire Erasmus chats with him and sends him off. He throws his gloves in the change room
bouncer outside off, Morgan gets out of the way
another sharp short ball angling across off, Morgan sways his upper body out of the way
full on off, driven back to the bowler
fuller and on the stumps, struck back to the bowler once again
overpitched and outside off, driven firmly to cover off the front foot
back of a length on off, whipped away through midwicket off the back foot
shortish on off, guided to point off the back foot
shorter and outside off, Root now finds the gap, steering to third man's right
short on the hips, glanced to fine leg
back of a length and too straight, tucked to the right of deep square leg
lifter, angling across Morgan, he sways his upper body out of the way
short on leg stump, Morgan stays leg-side of the ball and defends
short and angling in from round the wicket, Morgan drops his hands and lets it go
another sharp short ball, nearly rips off Morgan's glove as he fends at it
on a length and angling across off, driven to cover off the front foot
short, wide, cracked to point
short and angling across off, Root flaps at it and is beaten outside off
glanced off the hips to fine leg
Starc digs it short and outside off, Morgan backs away and scythes it up and over cover
Morgan hops and fends a short ball on middle to cover
short and outside off, bunted wide of short midwicket
short and skidding into the body, Morgan is tucked up for room as he fends at it
edged fine of deep third man
short, wide, smeared to sweeper cover
bouncer on middle, Morgan ducks under it
short at the body, fended off this time
pitched up on off, Morgan gives himself some swinging room and pumps it over mid-off
back of a length and outside off, punched to mid-off
pitched up and outside off, caressed to cover
short on middle, Root hops and fends it to point
full-toss sliding down the leg side, 149ks, helped away fine of long leg for four
back of a length on off, stabbed to point
shortish and outside off, punched away to the left of mid-off
spinning into the pads, clipped with the break to deep square leg
tossed outside off, Morgan reverse-sweeps and collects only fresh air
flighted on middle, Morgan dead-bats it away
shorter on middle, forced to extra-cover off the back foot
whoa! Pushed through on middle, Morgan drops down to one knee and nails a reverse-sweep over backward point. Such fast hands from Morgan
Morgan backs away and dinks this full ball towards third man
on the pads, worked away in front of square on the leg side
back of a length and holds its line outside off, Morgan feels for it and is beaten on the outside edge
pitched up and outside off, slower variation, Morgan slices it off the outside half. Finch runs around from mid-off, but the ball eludes his outstretched right hand
full on off, slogged straight to midwicket
short and angling into off from over the wicket, Morgan sizes it up and clobbers it away to the square-leg boundary. Pulled with great authority
hip-high short ball on off, this is swung away to the boundary rider at square leg
chopped from the stumps to deep point
tapped down to long-on for one
Morgan goes low and sweeps a non-turning offbreak past short fine leg for four
Morgan backs away and lashes a middle-stump ball to the cover boundary. Pinged off the middle of the bat
Morgan comes down the track, but is deceived in flight, offbreak, spins away, sliced but does not carry to short third man
short, wide, cut away for one
back of a length on off, spliced away to mid-on
banged in short and outside off, down the track and dragged to midwicket
bouncer outside off, Morgan shelves the hook and ignores it
back of a length and slanting in on middle, Morgan gets right behind the line and blocks
slower bouncer, floats down the leg side, beats Morgan's pull this time
Morgan ventures down the track and hacks a short ball from outside off to mid-on
floated up and worked with the spin to short fine leg
blapped in front of point! Morgan hurls the hands and slices up and over, skitters away to the rope
flighted from round the wicket, swept in front of square for a couple more
pushed through outside off, chopped through point
Root goes for the reverse styles now, swatted behind point and away - target coming rapidly into view
lobbed up straight and nudged off the pads
back of a length and steered towards point
slower ball down the leg side
angled across, tapped down into the covers
another slow cutter from Behrendorff, defended calmly propping on to the front foot
short ball, tennis-ball bounce and fetched from outside off stump, that'll race into the untended acres at midwicket for four more
full, dug out on off stump, Root looking for the quick single but Morgan declines
full toss helped away off leg stump for one
shortish and tapped down square on the off side
slapped on the up through point for four! Root whistles a square drive to the fence... Almost time to start the car
short and pulled... The crowd giving it the big'un but there's a man out there
full outside off, bunted into the covers
length outside off, 146kph/91mph and Root eases it to cover on the drive
short outside off and Root lashes a cut, brilliantly cut off on the dive by Glenn Maxwell! Full marks for effort, there
short and heaved over mid-on, England are in the World Cup final! Root and Morgan embrace, they've completed an eight-wicket demolition at Edgbaston
